TITLE: Human remains discovered in Lake Mead for fourth time as drought causes shoreline to retreat
SUMMARY: Skeletal human remains were discovered on the edge of Lake Mead, marking the fourth discovery of its kind since May as the lake's water level drops.<div class="fbz_enclosure" style="clear: left;">

TITLE: 2 shooters sought after rampage wounds 9 outside Cincinnati bar in Over-the-Rhine district
SUMMARY: At least nine people were wounded in a shooting outside Mr. Pitiful's bar on Sunday.<div class="fbz_enclosure" style="clear: left;">

TITLE: At least 5 victims in Pennsylvania house fire died of smoke inhalation, coroner says
SUMMARY: 10 people died in a Pennsylvania house fire early Friday, including three children. The coroner says at least five died from smoke inhalation.<div class="fbz_enclosure" style="clear: left;">

TITLE: Here's the biggest news you missed this weekend
SUMMARY: Indiana approved a sweeping abortion ban. And President Joe Biden is out of isolation after testing negative for COVID-19 (again). It's the weekend's biggest news.<div class="fbz_enclosure" style="clear: left;">

TITLE: AP Top Stories August 7 P
SUMMARY: Here's the latest for Sunday, August 7: Senate Democrats approve big Biden deal; Biden leaves WH for 1st time since getting COVID; Israel, Palestinians appear headed for cease-fire in Gaza; Adams blasts Abbott for dumping asylum seekers.<div style="clear: both; padding-top: 0.2em;">

TITLE: Today in History for August 8th
SUMMARY: Highlights of this day in history: President Richard Nixon says he'll resign; Thieves stage Britain's 'Great Train Robbery'; Nazi saboteurs in the U.S. executed during World War II; Mexico's Emiliano Zapata and actor Dustin Hoffman are born. (Aug. 8)<div style="clear: both; padding-top: 0.2em;">

TITLE: Cops combat violent crime as ranks shrink
SUMMARY: In cities across the U.S., an increase in violent crime is colliding with fewer police officers. From Philadelphia to Portland to Los Angeles, officers worn out by the pandemic and disillusioned over calls to divest from policing following George Floyd's murder by police are quitting or retiring early at the same time homicide rates and shootings are rising. (Aug. 8) (Video by Gillian Flaccus, Eugene Garcia and Matt Rourke/AP)<div style="clear: both; padding-top: 0.2em;">

TITLE: Flood just latest test for former coal town
SUMMARY: The city of Fleming-Neon, Kentucky has been gutted by the collapse of the region's coal industry. A devastating flood has erased some of the progress it has made, but residents are determined to rebuild and reinvent their town (Aug. 8)(Video; Allen Breed)<div style="clear: both; padding-top: 0.2em;">

TITLE: Ex-rebel sworn in as Colombia's president
SUMMARY: Colombia's first leftist President Gustavo Petro was sworn into office on Sunday in Bogota. (Aug. 8)<div style="clear: both; padding-top: 0.2em;">

TITLE: Israel, Palestinians agree on Gaza ceasefire
SUMMARY: The Palestinian Islamic Jihad Movement has announced a deal with Israel to end three days of violence that has killed dozens of Palestinians. (Aug 8)<div style="clear: both; padding-top: 0.2em;">

TITLE: AP Top Stories August 8 A
SUMMARY: Here's the latest for Monday August 8th: Senate passes big Biden budget package; Ceasefire between Israel and Palestinian militants holds overnight; 9 shot in Cincinnati; Biden going to Kentucky.<div style="clear: both; padding-top: 0.2em;">

TITLE: 9 wounded in shooting outside Cincinnati bar
SUMMARY: At least nine people were injured in a shooting outside a Cincinnati bar early Sunday, police said. The shooting took place shortly after 1:30 a.m. outside Mr. Pitiful's bar in the Ohio city's Over-the-Rhine district, a popular nightlife area. (Aug. 8)<div style="clear: both; padding-top: 0.2em;">

TITLE: FBI, Albuquerque police probe possible link among killings of 4 Muslim men. What we know.
SUMMARY: Authorities were searching for clues Monday into a possible link between the killings of four Muslim men in New Mexico over nine months.<div class="fbz_enclosure" style="clear: left;">

TITLE: 3 men who killed Ahmaud Arbery face sentencing in federal hate crimes trial
SUMMARY: Travis and Gregory McMichael and William 'Roddie' Bryan will be sentenced Monday for violating Ahmaud Arbery's civil rights in a federal trial.<div class="fbz_enclosure" style="clear: left;">

TITLE: Salty water threatens farms, cities in California
SUMMARY: The Sacramento-San Joaquin River Delta, a huge estuary northeast of San Francisco, supplies water to cities and farms across California. But a historic drought is making the delta's water increasingly salty, forcing farmers and cities to adapt. (Aug. 8) (Video by Terry Chea/AP)<div style="clear: both; padding-top: 0.2em;">

TITLE: Travis McMichael sentenced to life in prison on hate crime charges in Ahmaud Arbery's murder
SUMMARY: Travis McMichael  was sentenced to life in prison on federal hate crime charges in the murder of Ahmaud Arbery.<div class="fbz_enclosure" style="clear: left;">

TITLE: Ex-Colorado police officer sentenced for not intervening in arrest of woman with dementia
SUMMARY: A former Colorado police officer was sentenced to 45 days in jail for not intervening when an officer roughly arrested a 73-year-old with dementia.<div style="clear: both; padding-top: 0.2em;">
